00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the Trace buffer hardware.
00044  *
00045  * WRITING THE TRACE BUFFER
00046  *
00047  * When the trace is enabled, commands are traced continuously (wrapping) or until the buffer is filled once
00048  * (no wrapping).  Additionally and independent of wrapping, tracing can be temporarily enabled and disabled
00049  * by the tracing triggers.  All XMC commands can be traced except for IDLE and IOBRSP.  The subset of XMC
00050  * commands that are traced is determined by the filter and the two triggers, each of which is comprised of
00051  * masks for command, sid, did, and address).  If triggers are disabled, then only those commands matching
00052  * the filter are traced.  If triggers are enabled, then only those commands matching the filter, the start
00053  * trigger, or the stop trigger are traced during the time between a start trigger and a stop trigger.
00054  *
00055  * For a given command, its XMC data is written immediately to the buffer.  If the command has XMD data,
00056  * then that data comes in-order at some later time.  The XMD data is accumulated across all valid
00057  * XMD cycles and written to the buffer or to a shallow fifo.  Data from the fifo is written to the buffer
00058  * as soon as it gets access to write the buffer (i.e. the buffer is not currently being written with XMC
00059  * data).  If the fifo overflows, it simply overwrites itself and the previous XMD data is lost.
00060  *
00061  *
00062  * READING THE TRACE BUFFER
00063  *
00064  * Each entry of the trace buffer is read by a CSR read command.  The trace buffer services each read in order,
00065  * as soon as it has access to the (single-ported) trace buffer.
00066  *
00067  * On Octeon2, each entry of the trace buffer is read by two CSR memory read operations.  The first read accesses
00068  * bits 63:0 of the buffer entry, and the second read accesses bits 68:64 of the buffer entry. The trace buffer
00069  * services each read in order, as soon as it has access to the (single-ported) trace buffer.  Buffer's read pointer
00070  * increments after two CSR memory read operations.
00071  *
00072  *
00073  * OVERFLOW, UNDERFLOW AND THRESHOLD EVENTS
00074  *
00075  * The trace buffer maintains a write pointer and a read pointer and detects both the overflow and underflow
00076  * conditions.  Each time a new trace is enabled, both pointers are reset to entry 0.  Normally, each write
00077  * (traced event) increments the write pointer and each read increments the read pointer.  During the overflow
00078  * condition, writing (tracing) is disabled.  Tracing will continue as soon as the overflow condition is
00079  * resolved.  The first entry that is written immediately following the overflow condition may be marked to
00080  * indicate that a tracing discontinuity has occurred before this entry.  During the underflow condition,
00081  * reading does not increment the read pointer and the read data is marked to indicate that no read data is
00082  * available.
00083  *
00084  * The full threshold events are defined to signal an interrupt a certain levels of "fullness" (1/2, 3/4, 4/4).
00085  * "fullness" is defined as the relative distance between the write and read pointers (i.e. not defined as the
00086  * absolute distance between the write pointer and entry 0).  When enabled, the full threshold event occurs
00087  * every time the desired level of "fullness" is achieved.
00088  *
00089  *
00090  * Trace buffer entry format
00091  * @verbatim
00092  *       6                   5                   4                   3                   2                   1                   0
00093  * 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
00094  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00095  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | DWB   | diff timestamp|
00096  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00097  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | PL2   | diff timestamp|
00098  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00099  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | PSL1  | diff timestamp|
00100  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00101  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | LDD   | diff timestamp|
00102  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00103  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | LDI   | diff timestamp|
00104  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00105  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id  |   0   | LDT   | diff timestamp|
00106  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00107  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          | * or 16B mask | src id  |   0   | STC   | diff timestamp|
00108  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00109  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          | * or 16B mask | src id  |   0   | STF   | diff timestamp|
00110  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00111  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          | * or 16B mask | src id  |   0   | STP   | diff timestamp|
00112  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00113  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          | * or 16B mask | src id  |   0   | STT   | diff timestamp|
00114  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00115  * |sta|                          address[35:0]                                |    0    | src id| dest id |IOBLD8 | diff timestamp|
00116  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00117  * |sta|                          address[35:1]                              |     0     | src id| dest id |IOBLD16| diff timestamp|
00118  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00119  * |sta|                          address[35:2]                            |      0      | src id| dest id |IOBLD32| diff timestamp|
00120  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00121  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          |       0       | src id| dest id |IOBLD64| diff timestamp|
00122  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00123  * |sta|                          address[35:3]                          | * or 16B mask | src id| dest id |IOBST  | diff timestamp|
00124  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00125  * |sta|                     * or address[35:3]                          | * or length   | src id| dest id |IOBDMA | diff timestamp|
00126  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00127  *
00128  *
00129  * Trace buffer entry format in Octeon2 is different
00130  *
00131  *                 6                   5                   4                   3                   2                   1                   0
00132  * 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
00133  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00134  * |sta|                          address[37:0]                                  |       0           |  src id |  Group 1    | diff timestamp|
00135  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00136  * |sta|                          address[37:0]                                  | 0 |  xmd mask     |  src id |  Group 2    | diff timestamp|
00137  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00138  * |sta|                          address[37:0]                                  | 0 |s-did| dest id |  src id |  Group 3    | diff timestamp|
00139  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00140  * |sta|                         *address[37:3]                            | *Length       | dest id |  src id |  Group 4    | diff timestamp|
00141  * +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
00142  *
00143  * notes:
00144  * - diff timestamp is the difference in time from the previous trace event to this event - 1.  the granularity of the timestamp is programmable
00145  * - Fields marked as '*' are first filled with '0' at XMC time and may be filled with real data later at XMD time.  Note that the
00146  * XMD write may be dropped if the shallow FIFO overflows which leaves the '*' fields as '0'.
00147  * - 2 bits (sta) are used not to trace, but to return global state information with each read, encoded as follows:
00148  * 0x0=not valid
00149  * 0x1=valid, no discontinuity
00150  * 0x2=not valid, discontinuity
00151  * 0x3=valid, discontinuity
00152  * - commands are encoded as follows:
00153  * 0x0=DWB
00154  * 0x1=PL2
00155  * 0x2=PSL1
00156  * 0x3=LDD
00157  * 0x4=LDI
00158  * 0x5=LDT
00159  * 0x6=STF
00160  * 0x7=STC
00161  * 0x8=STP
00162  * 0x9=STT
00163  * 0xa=IOBLD8
00164  * 0xb=IOBLD16
00165  * 0xc=IOBLD32
00166  * 0xd=IOBLD64
00167  * 0xe=IOBST
00168  * 0xf=IOBDMA
00169  * - In Octeon2 the commands are grouped as follows:
00170  * Group1:
00171  *   XMC_LDT, XMC_LDI, XMC_PL2, XMC_RPL2, XMC_DWB, XMC_WBL2,
00172  *   XMC_SET8, XMC_SET16, XMC_SET32, XMC_SET64,
00173  *   XMC_CLR8, XMC_CLR16, XMC_CLR32, XMC_CLR64,
00174  *   XMC_INCR8, XMC_INCR16, XMC_INCR32, XMC_INCR64,
00175  *   XMC_DECR8, XMC_DECR16, XMC_DECR32, XMC_DECR64
00176  * Group2:
00177  *   XMC_STF, XMC_STT, XMC_STP, XMC_STC,
00178  *   XMC_LDD, XMC_PSL1
00179  *   XMC_SAA32, XMC_SAA64,
00180  *   XMC_FAA32, XMC_FAA64,
00181  *   XMC_FAS32, XMC_FAS64
00182  * Group3:
00183  *   XMC_IOBLD8, XMC_IOBLD16, XMC_IOBLD32, XMC_IOBLD64,
00184  *   XMC_IOBST8, XMC_IOBST16, XMC_IOBST32, XMC_IOBST64
00185  * Group4:
00186  *   XMC_IOBDMA
00187  * - For non IOB* commands
00188  * - source id is encoded as follows:
00189  * 0x00-0x0f=PP[n]
00190  * 0x10=IOB(Packet)
00191  * 0x11=IOB(PKO)
00192  * 0x12=IOB(ReqLoad, ReqStore)
00193  * 0x13=IOB(DWB)
00194  * 0x14-0x1e=illegal
00195  * 0x1f=IOB(generic)
00196  * - dest id is unused (can only be L2c)
00197  * - For IOB* commands
00198  * - source id is encoded as follows:
00199  * 0x00-0x0f = PP[n]
00200  * - dest   id is encoded as follows:
00201  * 0   = CIU/GPIO (for CSRs)
00202  * 1-2 = illegal
00203  * 3   = PCIe (access to RSL-type CSRs)
00204  * 4   = KEY (read/write operations)
00205  * 5   = FPA (free pool allocate/free operations)
00206  * 6   = DFA
00207  * 7   = ZIP (doorbell operations)
00208  * 8   = RNG (load/IOBDMA operations)
00209  * 10  = PKO (doorbell operations)
00210  * 11  = illegal
00211  * 12  = POW (get work, add work, status/memory/index loads, NULLrd load operations, CSR operations)
00212  * 13-31 = illegal
00213  * @endverbatim
00214  *
00215  * <hr>$Revision: 73845 $<hr>
00216  */
00217 
00218 #ifndef __CVMX_TRA_H__
00219 #define __CVMX_TRA_H__

00233 /* CSR typedefs have been moved to cvmx-tra-defs.h */
00234 
00235 /* The 'saa' filter command is renamed as 'saa64' */
00236 #define CVMX_TRA_FILT_SAA       CVMX_TRA_FILT_SAA64
00237 /* The 'iobst' filter command is renamed as 'iobst64' */
00238 #define CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST64
00239 
00240 /**
00241  * Enumeration of the bitmask of all the filter commands. The bit positions
00242  * correspond to Octeon2 model.
00243  */
00244 typedef enum {
00245     CVMX_TRA_FILT_NOP = 1ull << 0,
00246                       /**< none */
00247     CVMX_TRA_FILT_LDT = 1ull << 1,
00248                       /**< don't allocate L2 or L1 */
00249     CVMX_TRA_FILT_LDI = 1ull << 2,
00250                       /**< don't allocate L1 */
00251     CVMX_TRA_FILT_PL2 = 1ull << 3,
00252                       /**< pref L2 */
00253     CVMX_TRA_FILT_RPL2 = 1ull << 4,
00254                       /**< mark for replacement in L2 */
00255     CVMX_TRA_FILT_DWB = 1ull << 5,
00256                       /**< clear L2 dirty bit (no writeback) + RPL2 */
00257     CVMX_TRA_FILT_LDD = 1ull << 8,
00258                       /**< normal load */
00259     CVMX_TRA_FILT_PSL1 = 1ull << 9,
00260                       /**< pref L1, bypass L2 */
00261     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBDMA = 1ull << 15,
00262                        /**< store reflection by IOB for prior load */
00263     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STF = 1ull << 16,
00264                       /**< full block store to L2, fill 0's */
00265     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STT = 1ull << 17,
00266                       /**< full block store bypass-L2, fill 0's */
00267     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STP = 1ull << 18,
00268                       /**< partial store to L2 */
00269     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STC = 1ull << 19,
00270                       /**< partial store to L2, if duptag valid */
00271     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STFIL1 = 1ull << 20,
00272                       /**< full block store to L2, fill 0's, invalidate L1 */
00273     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STTIL1 = 1ull << 21,
00274                       /**< full block store bypass-L2, fill 0's, invalidate L1 */
00275     CVMX_TRA_FILT_FAS32 = 1ull << 22,
00276                       /**< to load from and write a word of memory atomically */
00277     CVMX_TRA_FILT_FAS64 = 1ull << 23,
00278                       /**< to load from and write a doubleword of memory atomically */
00279     CVMX_TRA_FILT_WBIL2I = 1ull << 24,
00280                       /**< writeback if dirty, invalidate, clear use bit, by index/way */
00281     CVMX_TRA_FILT_LTGL2I = 1ull << 25,
00282                       /**< read tag @ index/way into CSR */
00283     CVMX_TRA_FILT_STGL2I = 1ull << 26,
00284                       /**< write tag @ index/way from CSR */
00285     CVMX_TRA_FILT_INVL2 = 1ull << 28,
00286                       /**< invalidate, clear use bit, by address (dirty data is LOST) */
00287     CVMX_TRA_FILT_WBIL2 = 1ull << 29,
00288                       /**< writeback if dirty, invalidate, clear use bit, by address */
00289     CVMX_TRA_FILT_WBL2 = 1ull << 30,
00290                       /**< writeback if dirty, make clean, clear use bit, by address */
00291     CVMX_TRA_FILT_LCKL2 = 1ull << 31,
00292                       /**< allocate (if miss), set lock bit, set use bit, by address */
00293     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBLD8 = 1ull << 32,
00294                       /**< load reflection 8bit */
00295     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBLD16 = 1ull << 33,
00296                       /**< load reflection 16bit */
00297     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBLD32 = 1ull << 34,
00298                       /**< load reflection 32bit */
00299     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBLD64 = 1ull << 35,
00300                       /**< load reflection 64bit */
00301     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST8 = 1ull << 36,
00302                       /**< store reflection 8bit */
00303     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST16 = 1ull << 37,
00304                       /**< store reflection 16bit */
00305     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST32 = 1ull << 38,
00306                       /**< store reflection 32bit */
00307     CVMX_TRA_FILT_IOBST64 = 1ull << 39,
00308                       /**< store reflection 64bit */
00309     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SET8 = 1ull << 40,
00310                       /**< to load from and write 1's to 8bit of memory atomically */
00311     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SET16 = 1ull << 41,
00312                       /**< to load from and write 1's to 16bit of memory atomically */
00313     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SET32 = 1ull << 42,
00314                       /**< to load from and write 1's to 32bit of memory atomically */
00315     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SET64 = 1ull << 43,
00316                       /**< to load from and write 1's to 64bit of memory atomically */
00317     CVMX_TRA_FILT_CLR8 = 1ull << 44,
00318                       /**< to load from and write 0's to 8bit of memory atomically */
00319     CVMX_TRA_FILT_CLR16 = 1ull << 45,
00320                       /**< to load from and write 0's to 16bit of memory atomically */
00321     CVMX_TRA_FILT_CLR32 = 1ull << 46,
00322                       /**< to load from and write 0's to 32bit of memory atomically */
00323     CVMX_TRA_FILT_CLR64 = 1ull << 47,
00324                       /**< to load from and write 0's to 64bit of memory atomically */
00325     CVMX_TRA_FILT_INCR8 = 1ull << 48,
00326                       /**< to load and increment 8bit of memory atomically */
00327     CVMX_TRA_FILT_INCR16 = 1ull << 49,
00328                       /**< to load and increment 16bit of memory atomically */
00329     CVMX_TRA_FILT_INCR32 = 1ull << 50,
00330                       /**< to load and increment 32bit of memory atomically */
00331     CVMX_TRA_FILT_INCR64 = 1ull << 51,
00332                       /**< to load and increment 64bit of memory atomically */
00333     CVMX_TRA_FILT_DECR8 = 1ull << 52,
00334                       /**< to load and decrement 8bit of memory atomically */
00335     CVMX_TRA_FILT_DECR16 = 1ull << 53,
00336                       /**< to load and decrement 16bit of memory atomically */
00337     CVMX_TRA_FILT_DECR32 = 1ull << 54,
00338                       /**< to load and decrement 32bit of memory atomically */
00339     CVMX_TRA_FILT_DECR64 = 1ull << 55,
00340                       /**< to load and decrement 64bit of memory atomically */
00341     CVMX_TRA_FILT_FAA32 = 1ull << 58,
00342                       /**< to load from and add to a word of memory atomically */
00343     CVMX_TRA_FILT_FAA64 = 1ull << 59,
00344                       /**< to load from and add to a doubleword of memory atomically  */
00345     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SAA32 = 1ull << 62,
00346                       /**< to atomically add a word to a memory location */
00347     CVMX_TRA_FILT_SAA64 = 1ull << 63,
00348                       /**< to atomically add a doubleword to a memory location */
00349     CVMX_TRA_FILT_ALL = -1ull
00350                       /**< all the above filter commands */
00351 } cvmx_tra_filt_t;
00352 
00353 /*
00354  * Enumeration of the bitmask of all source commands.
00355  */
00356 typedef enum {
00357     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP0 = 1ull << 0,
00358                       /**< Enable tracing from PP0 with matching sourceID */
00359     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP1 = 1ull << 1,
00360                       /**< Enable tracing from PP1 with matching sourceID */
00361     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP2 = 1ull << 2,
00362                       /**< Enable tracing from PP2 with matching sourceID */
00363     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP3 = 1ull << 3,
00364                       /**< Enable tracing from PP3 with matching sourceID */
00365     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP4 = 1ull << 4,
00366                       /**< Enable tracing from PP4 with matching sourceID */
00367     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP5 = 1ull << 5,
00368                       /**< Enable tracing from PP5 with matching sourceID */
00369     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP6 = 1ull << 6,
00370                       /**< Enable tracing from PP6 with matching sourceID */
00371     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP7 = 1ull << 7,
00372                       /**< Enable tracing from PP7 with matching sourceID */
00373     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP8 = 1ull << 8,
00374                       /**< Enable tracing from PP8 with matching sourceID */
00375     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP9 = 1ull << 9,
00376                       /**< Enable tracing from PP9 with matching sourceID */
00377     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP10 = 1ull << 10,
00378                       /**< Enable tracing from PP10 with matching sourceID */
00379     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP11 = 1ull << 11,
00380                       /**< Enable tracing from PP11 with matching sourceID */
00381     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP12 = 1ull << 12,
00382                       /**< Enable tracing from PP12 with matching sourceID */
00383     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP13 = 1ull << 13,
00384                       /**< Enable tracing from PP13 with matching sourceID */
00385     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP14 = 1ull << 14,
00386                       /**< Enable tracing from PP14 with matching sourceID */
00387     CVMX_TRA_SID_PP15 = 1ull << 15,
00388                       /**< Enable tracing from PP15 with matching sourceID */
00389     CVMX_TRA_SID_PKI = 1ull << 16,
00390                       /**< Enable tracing of write requests from PIP/IPD */
00391     CVMX_TRA_SID_PKO = 1ull << 17,
00392                       /**< Enable tracing of write requests from PKO */
00393     CVMX_TRA_SID_IOBREQ = 1ull << 18,
00394                       /**< Enable tracing of write requests from FPA,TIM,DFA,PCI,ZIP,POW, and PKO (writes) */
00395     CVMX_TRA_SID_DWB = 1ull << 19,
00396                       /**< Enable tracing of write requests from IOB DWB engine */
00397     CVMX_TRA_SID_ALL = -1ull
00398                       /**< Enable tracing all the above source commands */
00399 } cvmx_tra_sid_t;
00400 
00401 #define CVMX_TRA_DID_SLI  CVMX_TRA_DID_PCI /**< Enable tracing of requests to SLI and RSL-type CSRs. */
00402 /*
00403  * Enumeration of the bitmask of all destination commands.
00404  */
00405 typedef enum {
00406     CVMX_TRA_DID_MIO = 1ull << 0,
00407                       /**< Enable tracing of CIU and GPIO CSR's */
00408     CVMX_TRA_DID_PCI = 1ull << 3,
00409                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to PCI and RSL type CSR's */
00410     CVMX_TRA_DID_KEY = 1ull << 4,
00411                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to KEY memory */
00412     CVMX_TRA_DID_FPA = 1ull << 5,
00413                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to FPA */
00414     CVMX_TRA_DID_DFA = 1ull << 6,
00415                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to DFA */
00416     CVMX_TRA_DID_ZIP = 1ull << 7,
00417                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to ZIP */
00418     CVMX_TRA_DID_RNG = 1ull << 8,
00419                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to RNG */
00420     CVMX_TRA_DID_IPD = 1ull << 9,
00421                       /**< Enable tracing of IPD CSR accesses */
00422     CVMX_TRA_DID_PKO = 1ull << 10,
00423                       /**< Enable tracing of PKO accesses (doorbells) */
00424     CVMX_TRA_DID_POW = 1ull << 12,
00425                       /**< Enable tracing of requests to RNG */
00426     CVMX_TRA_DID_USB0 = 1ull << 13,
00427                       /**< Enable tracing of USB0 accesses (UAHC0 EHCI and OHCI NCB CSRs) */
00428     CVMX_TRA_DID_RAD = 1ull << 14,
00429                       /**< Enable tracing of RAD accesses (doorbells) */
00430     CVMX_TRA_DID_DPI = 1ull << 27,
00431                       /**< Enable tracing of DPI accesses (DPI NCD CSRs) */
00432     CVMX_TRA_DID_FAU = 1ull << 30,
00433                       /**< Enable tracing FAU accesses */
00434     CVMX_TRA_DID_ALL = -1ull
00435                       /**< Enable tracing all the above destination commands */
00436 } cvmx_tra_did_t;
00437 
00438 /**
00439  * TRA data format definition. Use the type field to
00440  * determine which union element to use.
00441  *
00442  * In Octeon 2, the trace buffer is 69 bits,
00443  * the first read accesses bits 63:0 of the trace buffer entry, and
00444  * the second read accesses bits 68:64 of the trace buffer entry.
00445  */
00446 typedef union {
00447     struct {
00448 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00449         uint64_t datahi;
00450         uint64_t data;
00451 #else
00452         uint64_t data;
00453         uint64_t datahi;
00454 #endif
00455     } u128;
00456 
00457     struct {
00458 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00459         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00460         uint64_t valid:1;
00461         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00462         uint64_t address:36;
00463         uint64_t reserved:5;
00464         uint64_t source:5;
00465         uint64_t reserved2:3;
00466         uint64_t type:5;
00467         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00468 #else
00469         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00470         uint64_t type:5;
00471         uint64_t reserved2:3;
00472         uint64_t source:5;
00473         uint64_t reserved:5;
00474         uint64_t address:36;
00475         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00476         uint64_t valid:1;
00477         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00478 #endif
00479     } cmn;
00480        /**< for DWB, PL2, PSL1, LDD, LDI, LDT */
00481     struct {
00482 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00483         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00484         uint64_t valid:1;
00485         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00486         uint64_t address:33;
00487         uint64_t mask:8;
00488         uint64_t source:5;
00489         uint64_t reserved2:3;
00490         uint64_t type:5;
00491         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00492 #else
00493         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00494         uint64_t type:5;
00495         uint64_t reserved2:3;
00496         uint64_t source:5;
00497         uint64_t mask:8;
00498         uint64_t address:33;
00499         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00500         uint64_t valid:1;
00501         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00502 #endif
00503     } store;
00504          /**< STC, STF, STP, STT */
00505     struct {
00506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00507         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00508         uint64_t valid:1;
00509         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00510         uint64_t address:36;
00511         uint64_t reserved:2;
00512         uint64_t subid:3;
00513         uint64_t source:4;
00514         uint64_t dest:5;
00515         uint64_t type:4;
00516         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00517 #else
00518         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00519         uint64_t type:4;
00520         uint64_t dest:5;
00521         uint64_t source:4;
00522         uint64_t subid:3;
00523         uint64_t reserved:2;
00524         uint64_t address:36;
00525         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00526         uint64_t valid:1;
00527         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00528 #endif
00529     } iobld;
00530          /**< for IOBLD8, IOBLD16, IOBLD32, IOBLD64, IOBST, SAA */
00531     struct {
00532 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00533         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00534         uint64_t valid:1;
00535         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00536         uint64_t address:33;
00537         uint64_t mask:8;
00538         uint64_t source:4;
00539         uint64_t dest:5;
00540         uint64_t type:4;
00541         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00542 #else
00543         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00544         uint64_t type:4;
00545         uint64_t dest:5;
00546         uint64_t source:4;
00547         uint64_t mask:8;
00548         uint64_t address:33;
00549         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00550         uint64_t valid:1;
00551         uint64_t reserved3:64;
00552 #endif
00553     } iob;
00554        /**< for IOBDMA */
00555 
00556     struct {
00557 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00558         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00559         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00560         uint64_t valid:1;
00561         uint64_t addresshi:3;   /* Split the address to fit in upper 64 bits  */
00562         uint64_t addresslo:35;  /* and lower 64-bits. */
00563         uint64_t reserved:10;
00564         uint64_t source:5;
00565         uint64_t type:6;
00566         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00567 #else
00568         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00569         uint64_t type:6;
00570         uint64_t source:5;
00571         uint64_t reserved:10;
00572         uint64_t addresslo:35;
00573         uint64_t addresshi:3;
00574         uint64_t valid:1;
00575         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00576         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00577 #endif
00578     } cmn2;
00579         /**< for LDT, LDI, PL2, RPL2, DWB, WBL2, WBIL2i, LTGL2i, STGL2i, INVL2, WBIL2, LCKL2, SET*, CLR*, INCR*, DECR* */
00580     struct {
00581 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00582         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00583         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00584         uint64_t valid:1;
00585         uint64_t addresshi:3;   /* Split the address to fit in upper 64 bits  */
00586         uint64_t addresslo:35;  /* and lower 64-bits */
00587         uint64_t reserved:2;
00588         uint64_t mask:8;
00589         uint64_t source:5;
00590         uint64_t type:6;
00591         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00592 #else
00593         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00594         uint64_t type:6;
00595         uint64_t source:5;
00596         uint64_t mask:8;
00597         uint64_t reserved:2;
00598         uint64_t addresslo:35;
00599         uint64_t addresshi:3;
00600         uint64_t valid:1;
00601         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00602         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00603 #endif
00604     } store2;
00605           /**< for STC, STF, STP, STT, LDD, PSL1, SAA32, SAA64, FAA32, FAA64, FAS32, FAS64, STTIL1, STFIL1 */
00606     struct {
00607 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00608         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00609         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00610         uint64_t valid:1;
00611         uint64_t addresshi:3;   /* Split the address to fit in upper 64 bits  */
00612         uint64_t addresslo:35;  /* and lower 64-bits */
00613         uint64_t reserved:2;
00614         uint64_t subid:3;
00615         uint64_t dest:5;
00616         uint64_t source:5;
00617         uint64_t type:6;
00618         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00619 #else
00620         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00621         uint64_t type:6;
00622         uint64_t source:5;
00623         uint64_t dest:5;
00624         uint64_t subid:3;
00625         uint64_t reserved:2;
00626         uint64_t addresslo:35;
00627         uint64_t addresshi:3;
00628         uint64_t valid:1;
00629         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00630         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00631 #endif
00632     } iobld2;
00633           /**< for IOBLD8, IOBLD16, IOBLD32, IOBLD64, IOBST64, IOBST32, IOBST16, IOBST8 */
00634     struct {
00635 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00636         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00637         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00638         uint64_t valid:1;
00639         uint64_t addresshi:3;   /* Split the address to fit in upper 64 bits  */
00640         uint64_t addresslo:32;  /* and lower 64-bits */
00641         uint64_t mask:8;
00642         uint64_t dest:5;
00643         uint64_t source:5;
00644         uint64_t type:6;
00645         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00646 #else
00647         uint64_t timestamp:8;
00648         uint64_t type:6;
00649         uint64_t source:5;
00650         uint64_t dest:5;
00651         uint64_t mask:8;
00652         uint64_t addresslo:32;
00653         uint64_t addresshi:3;
00654         uint64_t valid:1;
00655         uint64_t discontinuity:1;
00656         uint64_t reserved1:59;
00657 #endif
00658     } iob2;
00659         /**< for IOBDMA */
00660 } cvmx_tra_data_t;
00661 
00662 /* The trace buffer number to use. */
00663 extern int _cvmx_tra_unit;

00665 /**
00666  * Setup the TRA buffer for use
00667  *
00668  * @param control TRA control setup
00669  * @param filter  Which events to log
00670  * @param source_filter
00671  *                Source match
00672  * @param dest_filter
00673  *                Destination match
00674  * @param address Address compare
00675  * @param address_mask
00676  *                Address mask
00677  */
00678 extern void cvmx_tra_setup(cvmx_tra_ctl_t control, cvmx_tra_filt_t filter, cvmx_tra_sid_t source_filter, cvmx_tra_did_t dest_filter, uint64_t address, uint64_t address_mask);
00679 
00680 /**
00681  * Setup each TRA buffer for use
00682  *
00683  * @param tra     Which TRA buffer to use (0-3)
00684  * @param control TRA control setup
00685  * @param filter  Which events to log
00686  * @param source_filter
00687  *                Source match
00688  * @param dest_filter
00689  *                Destination match
00690  * @param address Address compare
00691  * @param address_mask
00692  *                Address mask
00693  */
00694 extern void cvmx_tra_setup_v2(int tra, cvmx_tra_ctl_t control, cvmx_tra_filt_t filter,
00695                   cvmx_tra_sid_t source_filter, cvmx_tra_did_t dest_filter, uint64_t address, uint64_t address_mask);
00696 
00697 /**
00698  * Setup a TRA trigger. How the triggers are used should be
00699  * setup using cvmx_tra_setup.
00700  *
00701  * @param trigger Trigger to setup (0 or 1)
00702  * @param filter  Which types of events to trigger on
00703  * @param source_filter
00704  *                Source trigger match
00705  * @param dest_filter
00706  *                Destination trigger match
00707  * @param address Trigger address compare
00708  * @param address_mask
00709  *                Trigger address mask
00710  */
00711 extern void cvmx_tra_trig_setup(uint64_t trigger, cvmx_tra_filt_t filter, cvmx_tra_sid_t source_filter, cvmx_tra_did_t dest_filter, uint64_t address, uint64_t address_mask);
00712 
00713 /**
00714  * Setup each TRA trigger. How the triggers are used should be
00715  * setup using cvmx_tra_setup.
00716  *
00717  * @param tra     Which TRA buffer to use (0-3)
00718  * @param trigger Trigger to setup (0 or 1)
00719  * @param filter  Which types of events to trigger on
00720  * @param source_filter
00721  *                Source trigger match
00722  * @param dest_filter
00723  *                Destination trigger match
00724  * @param address Trigger address compare
00725  * @param address_mask
00726  *                Trigger address mask
00727  */
00728 extern void cvmx_tra_trig_setup_v2(int tra, uint64_t trigger, cvmx_tra_filt_t filter,
00729                    cvmx_tra_sid_t source_filter, cvmx_tra_did_t dest_filter, uint64_t address, uint64_t address_mask);
00730 
00731 /**
00732  * Read an entry from the TRA buffer. The trace buffer format is
00733  * different in Octeon2, need to read twice from TRA_READ_DAT.
00734  *
00735  * @return Value return. High bit will be zero if there wasn't any data
00736  */
00737 extern cvmx_tra_data_t cvmx_tra_read(void);
00738 
00739 /**
00740  * Read an entry from the TRA buffer from a given TRA unit.
00741  *
00742  * @param tra_unit  Trace buffer unit to read
00743  *
00744  * @return Value return. High bit will be zero if there wasn't any data
00745  */
00746 extern cvmx_tra_data_t cvmx_tra_read_v2(int tra_unit);
00747 
00748 /**
00749  * Decode a TRA entry into human readable output
00750  *
00751  * @param tra_ctl Trace control setup
00752  * @param data    Data to decode
00753  */
00754 extern void cvmx_tra_decode_text(cvmx_tra_ctl_t tra_ctl, cvmx_tra_data_t data);
00755 
00756 /**
00757  * Decode a TRA entry into human readable output
00758  *
00759  * @param tra_ctl Trace control setup
00760  * @param tra_unit Trace buffer unit
00761  * @param data    Data to decode
00762  */
00763 extern void cvmx_tra_decode_text_v2(int tra_unit, cvmx_tra_ctl_t tra_ctl, cvmx_tra_data_t data);

00765 /**
00766  * Display the entire trace buffer. It is advised that you
00767  * disable the trace buffer before calling this routine
00768  * otherwise it could infinitely loop displaying trace data
00769  * that it created.
00770  */
00771 extern void cvmx_tra_display(void);
00772 
00773 /**
00774  * Display the entire trace buffer. It is advised that you
00775  * disable the trace buffer before calling this routine
00776  * otherwise it could infinitely loop displaying trace data
00777  * that it created.
00778  *
00779  * @param tra_unit   Which TRA buffer to use.
00780  */
00781 extern void cvmx_tra_display_v2(int tra_unit);
00782 
00783 /**
00784  * Enable or disable the TRA hardware, by default enables all TRAs.
00785  *
00786  * @param enable 1=enable, 0=disable
00787  */
00788 static inline void cvmx_tra_enable(int enable)
00789 {
00790     cvmx_tra_ctl_t control;
00791     int tad;
00792 
00793     for (tad = 0; tad < CVMX_L2C_TADS; tad++) {
00794         control.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tad));
00795         control.s.ena = enable;
00796         cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tad), control.u64);
00797         cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tad));
00798     }
00799 }
00800 
00801 /**
00802  * Enable or disable a particular TRA hardware
00803  *
00804  * @param enable  1=enable, 0=disable
00805  * @param tra_unit  which TRA to enable, CN68XX has 4.
00806  */ static inline void cvmx_tra_enable_v2(int enable, int tra_unit)
00807 {
00808     cvmx_tra_ctl_t control;
00809 
00810     if ((tra_unit + 1) > CVMX_L2C_TADS) {
00811         cvmx_dprintf("cvmx_tra_enable: Invalid TRA(%d), max allowed are %d\n", tra_unit, CVMX_L2C_TADS - 1);
00812         tra_unit = 0;
00813     }
00814     control.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tra_unit));
00815     control.s.ena = enable;
00816     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tra_unit), control.u64);
00817     cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_TRAX_CTL(tra_unit));
00818 }
